args:
The party uses the wind shrine to drive off
Garuda, and learns the dragon is demanding a
sacrifice in exchange for protecting Louise and
Lowen's village from fiends. The group then
decides to skip the middleman and deal with
the fiends themselves.
Garuda's here! Now let's show her the\npower of our new shrine's mana!
With this wind to drive it, may this arrow\nstrike with sundering force!
Grrrk... What is this power?!\nNo...that shrine!
Bwaaaa ha ha ha! You would go so far\nmerely to deny me? So be it.
If that is your choice, then I shall rend the\nlot of you asunder and claim the boy as\nmy prize!
The day I return shall be the final day of\nyour pathetic lives!
I'm glad she's gone, but I fear greatly\nher wrath upon her inevitable return.
(Garuda looked really...lonely for a\nsecond. But why...?)
Garuda hasn't given up on getting Lowen,\nso we need to come up with a plan.
To that end, could you explain the situation\nto us in detail?
Yes. But first, I must thank you again for\nsaving us and make proper introductions.
My name is Louise, and this is my little\nbrother, Lowen.
We're from a small village far to the north\nof here.
Garuda has long protected our village from\nthe fiends that live nearby.
Wait, the same Garuda that's gunnin' for\nyer bro's life also PROTECTS yer village?!
Garuda is the guardian deity of the village,\nyes. However, one day, she suddenly\nbegan demanding a sacrifice from us.
I don't know. What I DO know, however,\nis that without Garuda's protection,\nour village would be doomed.
This is why the village heads opted to do\nas she demanded and offer her a sacrifice.
But when your brother was chosen to be\nthat sacrifice, the two of you fled instead?
Yes. Unfortunately, Garuda got wind of\nour escape and chose to pursue us.
What reason could she have for wanting a\nsacrifice so badly?
Does it matter? She's coming after Lowen,\nand we need to save him. That's the only\nimportant thing here.
Somehow I doubt that dragon's gonna\nlisten if we just ask her not to murder\nus real nice-like.
Then fighting is our only choice.
But if we defeat Garuda, your village will\nlose its protection and be attacked by\nfiends.
Ugh! This is like one of those stupid logic\npuzzles with the boat and the dog and the\nchicken or whatever!
Actually, I think I have an ideaâ€”although\nit's not without risk.
If the fiends near your village were gone,\nthere would be no need for a sacrifice,\nright?
You can't possibly... No, we cannot ask you\nto do this! Those fiends are a particularly\nvile and fearsome lot!
Actually, we're pretty good at this kind of\nthing. Let's head to your village and at\nleast get the lay of the land.
After all you have done for us, you would\ncontinue to put your own lives at risk?
I told you before, we can't leave you to\nsort this out on your own. Plus, I'm curious\nwhat caused Garuda's sudden change.
It's been a long time since we've\nencountered such kindness...
Yeah, and it's GREAT! Thanks a bunch,\neverybody!
You be a good boy and watch over things\nwhile we're gone, Lowen.
No way, Sis! I'm going! This is about ME,\nafter all!
No way, buster! This is going to be a\nperilous journey, which means you are\ngoing to sit it out!

Louise, once you've recovered, we'll set
off. Two or three days here at the castle
should be enough to get your strength
back, I imagine?
I'll leave some fresh clothes here.\nFeel free to make use of them.
Thank you, Cleo. ...Come here, Lowen.\nI'll help you get undressed.
Oh my gosh, Louise, I can do that myself!\nPlus Cleo is RIGHT HERE!
Don't you back talk me, mister!\nGet over here this instant!
All right, Lowen! Open up big and wide,\n'cause heeere comes the dragon!
Do you not trust your brother to consume\nfood on his own?
This meal is quite hazardous. The soup is\nhot, and there are small bones in the fish.
You, uh, ever think ya might be a bit of a\nmother hen with that kid?
Whatever are you talking about? This is a\nperfectly normal amount of care.
I'm merely looking for him so we can take\nour nightly bath, but he's nowhere to be\nfound.
Wait, his big sister gives him a BATH?\nI ain't usually one to judge, but I'm gonna\ngo ahead and call that super weird.
There's nothing wrong with it! If anything,\nYOU'RE the one with the problem!
Ugh. Even being away from him for this\nlong is making me itchy. ...Lowen!\nGet out here right now!
...Hey there, Lowen. What did you need?
I want you to fight me!
If I can beat you, then it means I'm strong,\nand Louise will HAVE to take me to the\nvillage with all of you!
Your sister is REALLY not going to like\nthis idea.
I don't care! This is MY problem, and I'm\ntired of relying on her for everything!
Plus, there's something I'm curious about.
I've actually been to Garuda's nest before.
...Who's there? State your business at\nonce or begone!
Hiya! I'm Lowen. I, um...just wanted to\nsee where you live.
You have come to my home to...play?
Yeah! And I know the grownups all told me\nnot to or whatever, but I couldn't help it!
I just reeeally wanted to see what your\nnest was like!
Then we are well met, young human.\nIt has been long and longer still since\nI have had a visitor in my home.
So, um...you're not mad at me?
At the fact you came here to visit me?\nOf course not! Please, take your time.\nLook around. Stay as long as you like.
Hearing that gives me a very different\nimpression of Garuda.
Louise would kill me if she knew I went\nto see Garuda, but I can't stop thinking\nabout it.
She was super nice to me that time,\nso why did she turn into such a big jerk?!
Thank you, Lowen. This may actually prove\nto be quite helpful.
And while I'm not going to fight you,\nI'm happy to spar. Show me what you\nknow and we'll go from there.
That's more than enough. You've proven\nplenty strong, so I see no reason why\nyou can't come to the village.
R-really?! I can?! YA-HOOOO! Thank you,\n{player_name}! Thank you!
This is the first time I've been given the\nchance to fight like this. Oh man, I've\nNEVER been this happy!
We're going to be facing fiends along the\nway, so I'm counting on you.
Yes, sir! I won't let you down!
